pull.title: test: deduplicates p2p_tx_download constants
pull.body: Some of the networking constants defined in p2p_tx_download.py are more generally defined in p2p.py

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31758.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [i-am-yuvi](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31758#issuecomment-2640833530), [danielabrozzoni](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31758#pullrequestreview-2615727315), [tdb3](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31758#pullrequestreview-2616521405), [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31758#issuecomment-2658397438) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

ACK efeaf2e0c1f0de0d7c3819eb9beaefee2ddf0710

```
TEST               | STATUS    | DURATION

p2p_tx_download.py | âœ“ Passed  | 33 s

ALL                | âœ“ Passed  | 33 s (accumulated)
```

@tdb3 I de-duplicated even more, plus renamed some of the remaining ones to match the actual names in `txdownloadman.h` (and updated the comment referring to `net_processing`, given the constants do not live there anymore).

As mentioned in-line, notice how `INBOUND_PEER_TX_DELAY` and `NONPREF_PEER_TX_DELAY` refer to the same concept. The latter was introduced in #20171 instead of remaining (or re-using) the former.

tACK 2b94e1abbfdef058546221d63f53b0b58eea22ea

The code looks good to me, I think renaming `MAX_GETDATA_IN_FLIGHT` to `MAX_PEER_TX_REQUEST_IN_FLIGHT` makes it easier to refer back to txdownloadman

events.message:
test: deduplicates p2p_tx_download constants

Some of the networking constants defined in p2p_tx_download.py are more generally
defined in p2p.py

Also, rename the remaining ones to match ones defined in txdownloadman

events.body:

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -43,13 +46,10 @@ def on_getdata(self, message):
 
 
 # Constants from net_processing
-GETDATA_TX_INTERVAL = 60  # seconds
 INBOUND_PEER_TX_DELAY = 2  # seconds
-TXID_RELAY_DELAY = 2 # seconds
 OVERLOADED_PEER_DELAY = 2 # seconds
 MAX_GETDATA_IN_FLIGHT = 100
 MAX_PEER_TX_ANNOUNCEMENTS = 5000
comments.body: Maybe it's worth migrating some of these to `p2p.py` as well?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -43,13 +46,10 @@ def on_getdata(self, message):
 
 
 # Constants from net_processing
-GETDATA_TX_INTERVAL = 60  # seconds
 INBOUND_PEER_TX_DELAY = 2  # seconds
-TXID_RELAY_DELAY = 2 # seconds
 OVERLOADED_PEER_DELAY = 2 # seconds
 MAX_GETDATA_IN_FLIGHT = 100
 MAX_PEER_TX_ANNOUNCEMENTS = 5000
comments.body:
I thought about this, but some of these are only used in this test.

I just realized that some of them were even duplicated amongst themselves. For instance, `INBOUND_PEER_TX_DELAY` and `NONPREF_PEER_TX_DELAY` refer to the same concept.

I'll do a second pass to further trim this

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -42,18 +46,13 @@ def on_getdata(self, message):
                 self.tx_getdata_count += 1
 
 
-# Constants from net_processing
-GETDATA_TX_INTERVAL = 60  # seconds
-INBOUND_PEER_TX_DELAY = 2  # seconds
-TXID_RELAY_DELAY = 2 # seconds
-OVERLOADED_PEER_DELAY = 2 # seconds
-MAX_GETDATA_IN_FLIGHT = 100
+# Constants from txdownloadman
+MAX_PEER_TX_REQUEST_IN_FLIGHT = 100
 MAX_PEER_TX_ANNOUNCEMENTS = 5000
comments.body: nit: Not a blocker, but would it make sense for all of these types of constants to live in `p2p.py`?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -42,18 +46,13 @@ def on_getdata(self, message):
                 self.tx_getdata_count += 1
 
 
-# Constants from net_processing
-GETDATA_TX_INTERVAL = 60  # seconds
-INBOUND_PEER_TX_DELAY = 2  # seconds
-TXID_RELAY_DELAY = 2 # seconds
-OVERLOADED_PEER_DELAY = 2 # seconds
-MAX_GETDATA_IN_FLIGHT = 100
+# Constants from txdownloadman
+MAX_PEER_TX_REQUEST_IN_FLIGHT = 100
 MAX_PEER_TX_ANNOUNCEMENTS = 5000
comments.body:
I don't have a strong opinion on this. 

I've checked and looks like no other test uses this, or re-defines it. I'd lean towards leaving it locally to avoid bloating `p2p.py`, but I'm open to move it if there is support for it

comments.diff_hunk:

                 self.tx_getdata_count += 1
 
 
-# Constants from net_processing

-INBOUND_PEER_TX_DELAY = 2  # seconds
-TXID_RELAY_DELAY = 2 # seconds
-OVERLOADED_PEER_DELAY = 2 # seconds
-MAX_GETDATA_IN_FLIGHT = 100
+# Constants from txdownloadman

 MAX_PEER_TX_ANNOUNCEMENTS = 5000
comments.body: Works for me. If/when the file is touched again, it could be moved then.
